title: Feature Request: Normalization via uncentered standard deviation
body_html:
Hello,

I'm currently trying to reproduce the results given in this paper.

The authors propose a normalization by uncentered standard deviation, which I will therefore implement on top of pytorch:

I would like to contribute this as UncenteredStandardDeviationNorm in 1d, 2d, 3d versions to pytorch.

Please feel free to leave feedback. Maybe we can find a less clunky name too, since the authors don't give one in their paper.

body:
Hello, 

I'm currently trying to reproduce the results given in [this paper](https://redes.unb.br/lasp/files/events/ICASSP2014/papers/p215-zhang.pdf). 

The authors propose a normalization by uncentered standard deviation, which I will therefore implement on top of pytorch:

![codecogseqn](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1852126/30640698-32eca1c2-9e04-11e7-9ded-2fe577e88ac2.gif)

I would like to contribute this as UncenteredStandardDeviationNorm in 1d, 2d, 3d versions to pytorch. 

Please feel free to leave feedback. Maybe we can find a less clunky name too, since the authors don't give one in their paper.
